head.title: Once Bowling, Now Baseball, At a Bank Building

hedline.hl1: Once Bowling, Now Baseball, At a Bank Building

abstract.p: Stahl Real Estate opens baseball center called Frozen Ropes, first of chain of such stores to open in New York City, on West 74th Street between Broadway and Amsterdam Avenue; logo (S)

block.p: There used to be a section under the bank building on West 74th Street between Broadway and Amsterdam Avenue that was used as a bowling alley, where employees socialized. It was also once a print shop, and most recently, used as storage space. But on July 11, the day of the Major League Baseball all-star game, Stahl Real Estate, the company that owns the landmark location, began using the large basement space at 202 West 74th Street for a baseball center called Frozen Ropes. It is the first Frozen Ropes in New York City.

Like the six others in the United States and Canada, Frozen Ropes offers batting cage and pitching mound rentals, birthday parties and corporate events, one-on-one professional instruction, weekend clinics and after-school programs for children 7 to 15. The center does not run a baseball league.
